Sentece: The pharmacokinetics of VCU was studied in a stereoselective manner following intraperitoneal (i.p.) administration to rats. (2S,3S)-VCU and (2R,3S)-VCU median effective dose ED(50) values were 29 mg/kg [95% confidence interval (CI) = 8-60 mg/kg] and 42 mg/kg (95% CI = 36-51 mg/kg) (MES) and 22 mg/kg (95% CI = 13-51 mg/kg) and 12 mg/kg (95%CI = 7-21 mg/kg) (scMet), respectively. (2S,3S)-VCU was more potent and had a wider safety margin (p < 0.05), defined as the protective index (PI = TD(50)/ED(50)), at both the MES (PI > 17) and scMet (PI > 23) tests than racemic-VCU or (R,S)-VCU (PI = 2.8 and 9.9, respectively).
Title: Evaluation of stereoselective anticonvulsant, teratogenic, and pharmacokinetic profile of valnoctylurea (capuride): a chiral stereoisomer of valproic acid urea derivative.
Name: Valproic Acid
